title: Temperature model version comparison
text:
Introduction
The EcoHSEDS temperature model gets updated approximately annually as new data are submitted to the database. Each update produces a new version. Here we examine changes in predictions between version 1.3 (Sept 2021) and version 1.4 (Jan 2024).
In addition to all the catchments, we focus on 2 areas with significant increases in data between versions, the Neversink in NY and the Potomac in Virginia.

title: 1  Get data
text:
1.1 Combine versions


Code
d13 <- d13 |> mutate(ver = 3)
d14 <- d14 |> mutate(ver = 4)

d <- bind_rows(d13, d14) |> 
  left_join(catchHucs, by = c("featureid" = "catchment_id"))

title: 1  Get data
section: 1.2 Stats for each version - all HUCs
text:
1.2 Stats for each version - all HUCs
Summarize some basic stats for each model version


Code
d |> 
  group_by(ver) |> 
  summarize(
    meanSummer = mean(mean_summer_temp),
    sdSummer = sd(mean_summer_temp)
  )


# A tibble: 2 × 3
    ver meanSummer sdSummer
  <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>
1     3       18.4     1.80
2     4       18.6     1.89

title: 1  Get data
section: 1.4 Stats for each version - Potomac and Neversink
text:
1.4 Stats for each version - Potomac and Neversink
Summarize some basic stats for each model version


Code
bind_rows(d2P, d2N) |> 
  group_by(huc12_name, ver) |> 
  summarize(
    meanSummer = mean(mean_summer_temp),
    sdSummer = sd(mean_summer_temp)
  )


# A tibble: 4 × 4
# Groups:   huc12_name [2]
  huc12_name   ver meanSummer sdSummer
  <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>
1 Neversink      3       15.7    0.836
2 Neversink      4       15.8    0.805
3 Potomac        3       19.2    0.743
4 Potomac        4       19.9    0.880

title: 2  All rivers
text:
2.1 Mean July temperature


Code
plotAll(dWide, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4","huc6")





Code
plotByHUC(dWide, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4", "huc6")

text:
